prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "'This Ain’t It, Chief' Updated To 'This Ain’t It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader'". Use it as a reference: U.S. - The popular internet comment response "This ain't it, chief," has been rightfully seen by many as problematic for years as it appropriates Native American culture in a derisive way, using the word "chief," which everybody knows is an offensive term. Native Americans have spent countless hours weeping since it was first coined.New Internet guidelines state that people must now say, "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." Leading social media platforms have already begun to implement an algorithm that automatically corrects the text any time a user types in the dated phrase. Experts say this will solve racism.The decision was arrived at after a recent Twitter user responded to a problematic tweet by saying, "this ain't it, chief" which led to another user responding, "This ain't it, CHIEF?! THIS ain't it, ch-- ch--" causing the software to meltdown, resulting in a momentary Twitter outage.Those who attempt to use the phrase in its out-dated format will be flagged and visited by the authorities.

candidate: Headline: "'This Ain't It, Chief' Updated To 'This Ain't It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader'"In a groundbreaking move to combat cultural appropriation and insensitivity, the internet has collectively decided to update the popular phrase "This ain't it, chief" to the more politically correct "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." The change comes after years of Native Americans shedding tears over the offensive use of the term "chief," which, as everyone knows, is a highly derogatory and hurtful word.Leading social media platforms have taken swift action to implement algorithms that automatically correct the offensive phrase whenever a user dares to type it. This revolutionary approach is expected to single-handedly solve racism once and for all, according to experts who have spent countless hours studying the impact of internet lingo on societal harmony.The decision to update the phrase came after a recent Twitter incident in which a user responded to a problematic tweet with "this ain't it, chief," causing another user to experience a meltdown while attempting to call out the offensive language. The resulting software glitch led to a brief Twitter outage, highlighting the severity of the situation.From now on, those who attempt to use the outdated phrase will be swiftly flagged by the authorities and subjected to a mandatory sensitivity training course. The course will cover topics such as "How to Respect Indigenous Cultures While Scrolling Through Memes" and "The Importance of Political Correctness in Online Discourse."Native American leaders have praised the move, with one spokesperson stating, "We can finally sleep at night knowing that the word 'chief' will no longer be used in a humorous context on the internet. Our ancestors can rest in peace, and our children can grow up in a world where they won't have to endure the trauma of seeing a three-letter word used in a joke."As the internet embraces this new era of heightened sensitivity and respect, we can all look forward to a future where online communication is free from any potential offense, and where the only tears shed are those of joy over the progress we've made as a society.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Using Our Prophetic Powers For Good: The Babylon Bee Will Now Only Write Articles About Positive Things Happening To Humanity". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Over the past few years, we have noticed a disturbing trend in our satire: it comes true. In the beginning, we thought it was just coincidence, but as the fulfilled prophecies continued to stack up, we came to accept the truth. We here at the Babylon Bee have been given the gift of prophetic vision, and it's time to use that spiritual gift for the good of mankind.It has therefore been decided that we will only make jokes about cool and good things so our future will be cool and good. Here are some of our headlines. Enjoy your new future!We have more, but that's probably enough goodness for now. We don't want to overdo it. You're welcome, world!

candidate: Using Our Prophetic Powers For Good: The Babylon Bee Will Now Only Write Articles About Positive Things Happening To HumanityIn a stunning turn of events, the satirical news site The Babylon Bee has announced that they will now only write articles about positive things happening to humanity. This decision comes after the realization that their satirical articles have been coming true at an alarming rate, leading them to believe that they possess prophetic powers."We've been given a gift," said the Bee's editor-in-chief, Kyle Mann. "It's time we use our spiritual gift for the good of mankind. From now on, we will only make jokes about cool and good things so our future will be cool and good."The Bee has already begun publishing articles with headlines such as "World Peace Achieved After Everyone Agrees to Just Be Nice," "Cure for Cancer Discovered in Grandma's Chicken Soup Recipe," and "Global Warming Reversed by Collective Positive Thinking."The response to the Bee's new direction has been overwhelmingly positive. "I always knew they had a higher purpose," said longtime reader Sarah Johnson. "I can't wait to live in the utopian future they're creating with their words."However, some critics have raised concerns about the potential consequences of the Bee's actions. "What if they write an article about everyone becoming immortal?" asked skeptic Mark Thompson. "Do we really want to live forever?"Despite these concerns, the Babylon Bee remains committed to their new mission. "We don't want to overdo it," said Mann. "But we believe that by focusing on the positive, we can create a better world for everyone. You're welcome, humanity!"Only time will tell if the Babylon Bee's prophetic powers will indeed lead to a brighter future for mankind. In the meantime, readers can look forward to a steady stream of uplifting and optimistic articles from the satirical news site.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big Sissy". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that."

candidate: Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big SissyU.S. - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that."The study has faced some criticism from the scientific community, with many experts questioning the validity of the research methods and the qualifications of the lead researcher. Dr. Emily Chen, an epidemiologist at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), stated, "I'm not sure how one can measure 'sissiness' in a controlled setting. Furthermore, Mr. Sullivan's background in 'sissiness research' is highly questionable."Despite the criticism, Sullivan stands by his findings and has even proposed a new scale for measuring sissiness, which he calls the "Sullivan Sissy Scale" or "SSS" for short. The scale ranges from 1 to 10, with 1 being "tough as nails" and 10 being "a total wimp who probably cries during commercials."In light of these findings, some local governments are considering revising their mask mandates to include exemptions for those who can prove their non-sissy status. Proposed methods for proving one's toughness include arm wrestling, chugging hot sauce, and watching tear-jerking movies without shedding a single tear.As the debate surrounding masks and sissiness continues, one thing remains clear: the coronavirus pandemic has brought out the best and the worst in people, and apparently, it's also brought out the sissy in some of us.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People Over". Use it as a reference: DAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - Benny Hinn is one of the best-known miraculous healers in the galaxy. His powers are formidable -- but he hasn't yet completed his training. So, Hinn got in his private jet and flew to Dagobah to complete his training in the ways of the Force with Jedi Master Yoda."Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," said Yoda."I will try," Hinn replied."Do, or do not. There is no try.""Well, I mean, I'm just going to declare victory over it," Hinn explained."That is why you fail," Yoda replied.Yoda set up various training courses in the swamps of Dagobah, from training dummies Hinn would have to try to pickpocket to a whole line of dummies he would have to knock over with his mind.In one horrible training session, Hinn went into a dark cave and was confronted by John MacArthur. "NOOOOO!!!!" Hinn screamed, running for his life after he was unable to knock MacArthur down with his Force powers.Yoda shook his head and smacked Hinn with his cane. "Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you.""Well, that all sounds pretty bad. But will I make a lot of money?""Oh, yeah, for sure," Yoda said."OK, cool," Hinn replied before pulling his private jet out of the swamp with his mind and flying back to his home planet.

candidate: DAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - In a shocking turn of events, renowned faith healer Benny Hinn has embarked on a journey to the swampy planet of Dagobah, seeking to enhance his already impressive abilities to knock people over with a mere wave of his hand. Sources close to Hinn reveal that the charismatic preacher aims to master the ways of the Force under the tutelage of the legendary Jedi Master Yoda.Upon arriving on Dagobah, Hinn was greeted by the diminutive green Jedi, who immediately put him through a series of rigorous training exercises. "Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," Yoda instructed. Hinn, ever confident, replied, "I will try." To which Yoda famously retorted, "Do, or do not. There is no try."Undeterred by Yoda's cryptic teachings, Hinn attempted to apply his signature style, declaring, "Well, I mean, I'm just going to declare victory over it." The Jedi Master, unimpressed, simply responded, "That is why you fail."Yoda's training regimen included a variety of challenges designed to test Hinn's Force abilities, from pickpocketing training dummies to knocking over entire lines of mannequins with his mind. However, the most harrowing experience came when Hinn ventured into a dark cave and found himself face-to-face with his arch-nemesis, John MacArthur. Unable to subdue MacArthur with his Force powers, Hinn fled the cave, screaming in terror.In response to Hinn's fear, Yoda imparted his wisdom, stating, "Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you." Hinn, ever the pragmatist, inquired about the financial benefits of mastering the dark side, to which Yoda assured him, "Oh, yeah, for sure."With the promise of continued wealth and success, Hinn completed his training on Dagobah, demonstrating his newfound abilities by pulling his private jet out of the swamp using only his mind. As he departed for his home planet, the galaxy eagerly awaits the next chapter in the saga of Benny Hinn, the Force-wielding faith healer.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters". Use it as a reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - The Trump White House has added a new feature to the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room: a separate cry room for fussy reporters who are crying during press briefings and interrupting the proceedings.The quiet, serene room will allow news agencies to take their crying, wailing, fussy reporters into a separate space to calm them down so the press briefings can continue without interruption."If you notice one of your reporters starting to tear up, just take them into the cry room and soothe them before joining us again," said Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany. "There are pictures of Obama, bottles of kombucha, and some Tickle-You-Biden plushies in there to keep them occupied and help them feel safe.""Hey, wait a minute! Are you saying we're babies!?" shouted one reporter, tears welling up in his eyes."Well, yes," McEnany replied."That's... that's mean!" His lip began to quiver and he was forced to excuse himself to the cry room."WAAAAHHH!!!" cried Jim Acosta. "ORANGE MAN BAD! ORANGE MAN BAD!" One of his fellow CNN reporters cradled him in her arms and took him out into the cry room with an apologetic look on her face.The cry room may need expanding soon, however, since every single reporter except OANN's Chanel Rion was sent to the cry room during the first press briefing. Rion pointed and laughed at them as they went into the cry room, calling them "dumb babies," which made them cry harder.

candidate: Here's a satirical article based on the reference you provided:Headline: "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters"WASHINGTON, D.C. - In a groundbreaking move to accommodate the emotional needs of the press corps, the Biden White House has introduced a dedicated cry room for reporters who find themselves overwhelmed during press briefings.The cozy, safe-space room is equipped with essential amenities such as coloring books featuring President Biden's favorite ice cream flavors, life-size cardboard cutouts of former President Obama, and a soothing soundtrack of Kamala Harris's infectious laughter on loop."We understand that our reporters are dealing with a lot of stress, especially when faced with tough questions like 'What's your favorite color?' or 'How do you feel about puppies?'" said White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre. "This cry room will provide them with a much-needed retreat to collect themselves before returning to the briefing room."The first reporter to christen the cry room was CNN's chief White House correspondent, who burst into tears when asked about the President's recent trip to the ice cream parlor. "It's just so beautiful to see our leader enjoying a cone of chocolate chip!" he sobbed, as his colleagues gently guided him to the cry room.Not everyone is thrilled with the new addition, however. Fox News reporters have complained that the cry room is a blatant attempt to coddle the "liberal snowflakes" in the media. In response, the White House has promised to install a special "anger room" for conservative reporters, complete with punching bags featuring images of Hillary Clinton and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.As the cry room becomes increasingly populated during press briefings, the White House is considering expanding the space to accommodate the growing number of emotionally fragile reporters. Plans are also in the works for a "timeout corner" for journalists who misbehave or ask questions that deviate from the approved list of topics.While some critics argue that the cry room is a sign of the media's declining standards, others praise the Biden administration for its commitment to creating a more inclusive and nurturing environment for the press. As one tearful reporter put it, "It's just so refreshing to have a President who understands our needs and doesn't make us feel like we're fake news."

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Children Threaten To Help". Use it as a reference: MAPLE BLUFFS, IA - Justin Daniels was painting the kitchen, already working hard to not drop paint on anything where paint didn't go, when a further complication was added: His five-year-old and three-year-old sons expressed a desire to help."I knew instilling in my children a desire to help others was going to come back to haunt me," Daniels told reporters. "I mean, can you imagine? It would take at least twice as long and I'd be cleaning paint off the counters for days."Daniels tried to come up with some menial tasks for the kids, such as putting painter's tape on things that didn't particularly need it, but the children insisted on helping with the core task of painting."That's when I came up with a brilliant idea," Daniels said. "I told them I was so happy that they were such good children who wanted to help that I'd reward them with a new video game. It cost me sixty bucks, but it took away any desire they had to help anyone with anything."With the children playing their new video game, Daniels was able to paint in peace, other than his kids occasionally screaming at each other.

candidate: MAPLE BLUFFS, IA - In a shocking turn of events, local children have threatened to assist their parents with household chores, sending shockwaves through the community and striking fear into the hearts of unsuspecting adults.Justin Daniels, a resident of Maple Bluffs, was in the midst of a kitchen painting project when his two young sons, aged five and three, expressed their terrifying intention to lend a helping hand. "I couldn't believe what I was hearing," Daniels confessed to reporters, visibly shaken by the ordeal. "The thought of my kids 'helping' me paint was enough to make me break out in a cold sweat."Daniels, like many parents, had worked tirelessly to instill a sense of helpfulness in his children, never anticipating that it would come back to haunt him in such a horrifying manner. The mere idea of his sons participating in the painting process conjured images of paint-splattered countertops and endless hours of cleanup.In a desperate attempt to thwart their well-intentioned but disastrous offers of assistance, Daniels devised a series of menial tasks for the children, such as applying painter's tape to surfaces that were already adequately protected. However, the determined youngsters remained undeterred, insisting on taking part in the core task of painting.Faced with the imminent threat of his children's "help," Daniels resorted to a brilliant yet costly solution. "I promised them a new video game if they agreed to leave me alone," he admitted, a hint of relief in his voice. "It set me back sixty bucks, but it was a small price to pay for the peace of mind and the assurance that my kitchen would remain relatively unscathed."With the children now thoroughly engrossed in their newly acquired video game, Daniels was able to complete the painting project in relative tranquility, interrupted only by the occasional screams of sibling rivalry emanating from the next room.This alarming incident serves as a stark reminder to parents everywhere that no good deed goes unpunished. As more and more children threaten to help with household tasks, experts advise adults to remain vigilant and to have a stockpile of video games and other distractions at the ready, lest they fall victim to the well-meaning but ultimately destructive "assistance" of their offspring.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Trump Replaces Washington Monument With Giant Can Of Goya Beans". Use it as a reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - Liberals have been complaining about the Washington Monument, which is named after the notorious racist George Washington. Well, Trump is now appeasing them, having taken down the century-old obelisk, replacing it with a 350-foot-tall can of Goya pinto beans.The authentic Goya can is 350 feet tall and 200 feet wide and contains 82,252,607 gallons of beans."This is the largest can of Goya beans, maybe ever," said President Trump at the dedication ceremony. "Way bigger than some of the other countries' statues and monuments. This thing makes the Eiffel Tower look laughable. I mean that literally. You look at the Eiffel Tower and you just laugh. It's not even finished. You can still see the frame. And does it have beans? Well, maybe at that snooty French restaurant. But probably not. Probably not. They just have dumb French food like cheese with funny names and bread. Admittedly the bread smells pretty good, but it doesn't live up to that when you eat it. Always smells better than it tastes. Everyone says so."Liberals tried to criticize the move but were unable to do so since they would be siding with George Washington. Plus, the optics of tearing down a monument to a Latino businessman would just be bad. "We've been played again," said Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi. "This guy really is a genius."

candidate: WASHINGTON, D.C. - In a stunning move that has left the nation's capital in awe, President Donald Trump has ordered the removal of the iconic Washington Monument and replaced it with a colossal can of Goya beans. The decision comes amidst growing criticism from liberals who have been calling for the removal of monuments dedicated to historical figures with controversial pasts, including the nation's first president, George Washington.The new monument, a towering 350-foot-tall replica of a Goya pinto bean can, boasts an impressive width of 200 feet and a capacity of 82,252,607 gallons of beans. President Trump, known for his penchant for superlatives, proudly declared during the dedication ceremony, "This is the largest can of Goya beans, maybe ever. Way bigger than some of the other countries' statues and monuments. This thing makes the Eiffel Tower look laughable."The president went on to criticize the French landmark, stating, "You look at the Eiffel Tower and you just laugh. It's not even finished. You can still see the frame. And does it have beans? Well, maybe at that snooty French restaurant. But probably not. They just have dumb French food like cheese with funny names and bread. Admittedly the bread smells pretty good, but it doesn't live up to that when you eat it. Always smells better than it tastes. Everyone says so."Liberals, who have been vocal in their opposition to monuments celebrating controversial historical figures, found themselves in a quandary. Unable to criticize the move without appearing to side with George Washington, and faced with the potential backlash of opposing a monument to a successful Latino businessman, they were left scratching their heads.Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi admitted, "We've been played again. This guy really is a genius."The giant Goya bean can now stands as a testament to the president's unwavering support for the Latino community and his commitment to promoting diversity in the nation's capital. While some may question the aesthetic value of the new monument, there is no denying its impact on the Washington, D.C. skyline and its ability to spark conversation about the complex nature of American history and the role of monuments in our society.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Hack Suspected As Biden Posts Complete, Coherent Thought On Twitter". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Hackers have been blamed as Joe Biden posted a complete, coherent thought on Twitter earlier today.As soon as Twitter support saw that Biden had posted several complete sentences in a tweet, they immediately locked his account down, suspecting a hack."The full, rational sentences were a dead giveaway," said a Twitter IT guy. "If you're gonna pretend to be Joe Biden, you have to add in several rambling asides, some made-up words, and three or four major gaffes. It clearly wasn't him, so we took steps to lock down his account.""Hackers, you know, thhhhe--the thing that, that hacks--hackers are dangerous," said Joe Biden in a statement to the press. "Back in my day, hackers were the guys who would cut down your telegram wire and listen in on the ol' party line. My cousin, Velma, she once said..." At this point, he abruptly fell asleep.Meanwhile, President Trump's account posted several deranged rants about random stuff, assuring everyone that his account had not been compromised.

The stark contrast between the two accounts has left many Americans wondering if they should be more concerned about the potential for a coherent thought from Biden or the ongoing stream of incoherent ramblings from the current president.As the investigation into the alleged hack continues, Twitter has vowed to implement stricter security measures to prevent any future instances of complete, coherent thoughts being shared on the platform by political figures. The nation remains on high alert, anxiously awaiting the next tweet from either candidate, hoping for a return to the familiar, incoherent norm that has come to define the 2020 presidential race.

candidate: LOS ANGELES, CA - In a shocking turn of events, rapper and presidential hopeful Kanye West has announced his withdrawal from the 2020 U.S. presidential race. The decision comes after a groundbreaking offer from tech mogul Elon Musk, who has promised West the coveted position of President of Mars."I've always dreamed of being the leader of the free world," West said in an exclusive interview. "But when Elon approached me with the opportunity to rule an entire planet, I knew I had to jump at the chance. America is cool, but Mars is the future. It's the ultimate power move."Musk, who has been vocal about his plans to colonize the Red Planet, believes that West is the perfect candidate to lead the Martian government. "Kanye is a visionary, just like me," Musk stated. "He has the creativity, the boldness, and the ego to make Mars great again. Together, we'll build a society that will make the Earthlings green with envy."Sources close to West reveal that the rapper has already begun drafting plans for his Martian administration. His top priorities include establishing a space force, constructing a giant statue of himself visible from Earth, and renaming Mars' moons to "Ye" and "Kim."West's decision to abandon his Earth-based political aspirations has sent shockwaves through the American electorate. Supporters are torn between disappointment and admiration for his cosmic ambitions. "I was really hoping to vote for Kanye," said one die-hard fan. "But I guess being President of Mars is pretty cool too. I just hope he doesn't forget about us little people back on Earth."As for the future of the U.S. presidential race, pundits are scrambling to assess the impact of West's withdrawal. Some believe that his absence will create a vacuum for other eccentric billionaires to fill, while others argue that the race will now return to its regularly scheduled programming of career politicians and empty promises.Meanwhile, West and Musk are wasting no time in preparing for their Martian takeover. The duo has reportedly commissioned a fleet of gold-plated spacecraft and has begun recruiting a team of elite space cadets to join them on their interplanetary journey.As the world watches in awe and disbelief, one thing is certain: with Kanye West at the helm, the future of Mars promises to be a wild ride. Stay tuned for updates on this developing story, as we continue to bring you the latest news from the final frontier of politics.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "More People Voluntarily Committing Themselves To Asylums To Escape Insanity Of Real World". Use it as a reference: U.S. - More people are voluntarily committing themselves to mental institutions in an attempt to escape the ever-increasing insanity of the real world.Thousands of people have checked themselves in at psychiatric wards across the country, claiming to be insane, in order to get away from the absolute insanity of everything that's happening outside."Oh yeah, I'm totally crazy, 100%," said Frank Zwygart as he checked himself in to an asylum in Arkham. "I think I'm Napoleon Bonaparte or whatever. Yep, totally insane.""That guy over there swinging the golf club at the orderly thinks we're living in a simulation, while Bob over in the corner thinks he's God," said recently committed man Frank Zwygart. "So yeah, it's a little less crazy than things out there. We don't worry about stuff like Kanye running for president, murder hornets, nunchuck bears, bubonic squirrels, World War 3, or getting doxxed for old tweets. And they've got lots of great board games in here.""Plus, Bob's actually a pretty cool guy once you get to know him," he added as he adjusted his straitjacket. "Actually, he's totally sane -- his beliefs make perfect sense to him. There's an internal logic to everything he believes, unlike some of the crazies you try to talk to out there in the crazy world."

candidate: Headline: "More People Voluntarily Committing Themselves To Asylums To Escape Insanity Of Real World"In a bizarre turn of events, mental institutions across the United States are reporting a surge in voluntary commitments as people desperately seek to escape the ever-increasing insanity of the real world. Thousands of seemingly sane individuals have willingly checked themselves into psychiatric wards, claiming to be suffering from a variety of outlandish delusions in order to gain admission."I'm Napoleon Bonaparte, I swear," insisted Frank Zwygart, a recent arrival at the Arkham Asylum. "I'm totally bonkers, and I definitely belong here." Zwygart, along with many others, has found solace within the padded walls of the institution, where the daily concerns of the outside world pale in comparison to the eccentric beliefs of their fellow patients."Sure, the guy over there thinks we're living in a simulation, and Bob in the corner believes he's God," Zwygart explained, gesturing towards his new companions. "But honestly, it's a lot less crazy than the stuff happening out there. In here, we don't have to worry about Kanye's presidential bid, murder hornets, nunchuck bears, bubonic squirrels, World War 3, or getting doxxed for old tweets. Plus, the board game selection is fantastic."As Zwygart adjusted his straitjacket, he added, "And you know what? Bob's actually a pretty cool guy once you get to know him. His beliefs make perfect sense to him, which is more than I can say for some of the crazies you encounter in the so-called 'real world.'"Mental health experts are baffled by this new trend, with some speculating that the collective stress of recent events has driven people to seek refuge in the structured environment of psychiatric institutions. Others argue that the patients are simply ahead of the curve, recognizing that the world has indeed gone mad.Regardless of the underlying reasons, one thing is clear: as the insanity of the outside world continues to escalate, more and more people are finding peace and sanity within the walls of mental institutions. And who can blame them?
